product_name: Four-Stone Green Gemstone Ring in Yellow Gold
overall_description: A fine jewelry piece featuring a yellow gold band with a linear arrangement of four round-cut green gemstones (likely emeralds or tsavorites) secured in a high-profile prong setting. The ring features a polished finish and internal engraving.

components.shape_description: Circular toroid segment with a 'D' profile (flat interior, domed exterior). Tapers slightly in thickness towards the base.
components.position: Base of the ring, encircling the finger
components.manufacturing_notes: Cast as a single unit with the setting head. Includes internal laser engraving 'adhav'. Requires high polish.

components.shape_description: Linear array of four basket-style seats with vertical prongs rising from the bridge. Open side-profile design to allow light entry.
components.position: Top center of the ring, integrated into the shank
components.manufacturing_notes: Likely modeled and cast integrally with the shank (Component 1). Prongs must be cast longer than finished height to allow for setting/burring over the stones.

components.position: Mounted inside the Prong Setting Gallery
components.manufacturing_notes: Stones must be matched in color and size. Set by cutting seats into the prongs and pushing metal over the girdle.

additional_notes: The assembly process involves 'Lost Wax Casting' for the metal components (1 and 2 combined), followed by cleanup/sprue removal, pre-polishing, stone setting (hand labor), and final buffing. The engraving is likely applied via laser after casting or included in the 3D print/wax model.
